title: The Apprentice fired candidate reveals scenes of show were 'edited out'
text:
Riyonn said The Apprentice showed some of his dumb moments (Picture: PA/BBC)

Riyonn Farsad is the latest candidate to be fired on The Apprentice and following his exit, the 30-year-old revealed that some of the scenes were ‘edited out’ to show his ‘dumb moments’.

On tonight’s episode, the budding entrepreneurs were split into groups as they visited the historic university cities of Oxford and Cambridge to procure nine items that are associated with both places – and it’s safe to say that both teams found the task a bit tricky (because they didn’t know what all of the items were).

The challenge required each team to negotiate prices for the objects on the list and for anything that was missing, they were charged a fine.

In the boardroom Lord Sugar directly spoke to Riyonn, Jemelin Artigas and Ryan-Mark Parsons, and went on to explain his reasons for who he was firing.

‘Jemelin, it is not clear why you put yourself forward to be PM as you had no idea what any of the items were,’ he started.

‘I think the problem was that you don’t have any leadership skills, you’re not a great leader.’

Riyonn in one of the challenges…. (Picture: BBC)

He proceeded to talk to Ryan-Mark, he added: ‘Young man you remind me of a weathercock, it turns in the direction of the wind, tell me why I shouldn’t fire you?

‘Riyonn, every time I point something out, you have a way of wriggling out of it and I don’t see you as my business partner and because of that you’re fired.’

The events manager from London was the fifth candidate to leave, and despite being ‘gutted’, he told Metro.co.uk that some of the scenes were edited out.

He laughed: ‘They did show a few of my dumb moments, but that’s just me without my phone, but I wasn’t worried about the edit as I came across as who I am.

‘When we did the safari, we did a tour with all the animals and I had no idea what the animals were so I thought “that’s going to make me look great on TV isn’t it?”‘

Riyonn struck up an unlikely friendship with Thomas (Picture:BBC)

Riyonn went on to explain that he didn’t feel like he should have been fired from the show so soon.

Advertisement

‘I definitely think someone else should have gone, I was clearly meant to be his business partner,’ he said.

‘If not his business partner I was hoping to land in the top five, but I think it was because of the way I went about it. I put myself forward as project manager all the time, I got stuck in and I didn’t want to sit in the background so I was put on the chopping block a lot more compared to other people.

‘Our team did lose but I wasn’t to blame for a lot of losses and out of that task, in general, I wasn’t the weakest link. I point my finger to Ryan-Mark because he scoots along and that’s how some people play the game but that’s not how I wanted to play it.

‘I was hoping he would go but I got that finger instead.’

The 30-year-old admitted that the boardroom goes on for a full day so, in actual fact, a lot of it is cut from the show.

Last week Lubna Farhan was fired, and since leaving the show she revealed that her boardroom scene was cut completely.

Riyonn also felt several of the candidates ‘played up to the camera’.

He added: ‘A lot does get edited from the show but I am not worried as I feel like I left with my head held high.

‘I won’t say anyone in particular but on and off camera with certain characters there is a big difference and as soon as the cameras roll, they are 100% more amped up than normal and I would say “guys why don’t you just be yourself, why do you have to be different on camera?” but I guess that’s how they wanted to play it.

‘I think that’s why it was more frustrating because they came across as good, but then off-camera they weren’t that way in person.’

The Apprentice continues Wednesday at 9pm on BBC One.
